intro: Lepidagathis lanatoglabra var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
